elements.title: Möbius strip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the recycling symbol (pictured) depicts a Möbius strip?

elements.title: Nick Schmaltz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nick Schmaltz's older brother and younger sister would team up against him when they played basement hockey as children?

elements.title: Hun speech (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the former German chancellor Bernhard von Bülow called Wilhelm II's 1900 Hun speech the "worst speech of that time and perhaps the most disgraceful speech that Wilhelm II [had] ever given"?

elements.title: people will paradoxically doubt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that if a disaster is avoided through planning and vigilance, people will paradoxically doubt that the preparation was necessary?

elements.title: the only club to have beaten all 91 other clubs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Port Vale F.C. is the only club to have beaten all 91 other clubs in the top four divisions of the current English football league system in a competitive league fixture?

elements.title: Eoseira wilsonii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eoseira wilsonii "slime" likely helped in fossil preservation?

elements.title: Who Cares? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Balanchine's ballet Who Cares?, to songs written by George Gershwin, is likened to "a tap dance on pointe"?

elements.title: Klaus Wallrath (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Klaus Wallrath composed a mass for peace for the 2018 Katholikentag in Münster, performed to an audience of more than 30,000 by a choir, an orchestra, and a dance company?
